program codeforces_518_B

  implicit none

  character(len=:), allocatable :: s, t

  integer :: ura = 0, opa =0

  integer, dimension(0:255) :: tmap =0

  integer :: slen, i

  logical,allocatable :: used(:)

  character :: ch, rch

  ! Read inputs:

  read(*,'(A)') s

  read(*,'(A)') t

  slen = len_trim(s)

  ! allocate used array

  allocate( used(1:slen) )

  used = .false.

  ! process t into tmap:

  integer :: tlen, ic_t

  tlen = len_trim(t)

  do i = 1, tlen

     ch = t(i:i)

     ic_t = ichar(ch)

     tmap( ic_t ) = tmap( ic_t ) +1

  end do

  ! first loop for ura:

  do i =1, slen

     if ( used(i) ) cycle

     ch = s(i:i)

     ic = ichar(ch)

     if ( tmap( ic ) <=0 ) cycle

     ura = ura +1

     tmap( ic ) = tmap( ic ) -1

     used(i) = .true.

  end do

  ! second loop for opa

  do i=1, slen

     if ( used(i) ) cycle

     ch = s(i:i)

     rch = reverse_char( ch )

     ic_r = ichar(rch)

     if ( tmap( ic_r ) <=0 ) cycle

     opa = opa +1

     tmap( ic_r ) = tmap( ic_r ) -1

     used(i) = .true.

  end do

  ! output

  print '(I0,1X,I0)', ura, opa

contains

  function reverse_char(ch) result(r)

    character, intent(in) :: ch

    character :: r

    if ( ch >= 'a' .and. ch <= 'z' ) then

    else if ( ch >= 'A' .and. ch <= 'Z' ) then 

       r = achar( ichar(ch) + 32 )

    else

       r = ch

    end if

  end function reverse_char

end program

The full code in Fortran would look like:

program codeforces_518_B
    implicit none
    character(len=:), allocatable :: s, t
    integer :: ura = 0, opa = 0
    integer, dimension(0:255) :: tmap = 0
    integer :: slen, tlen, i
    logical, allocatable :: used(:)
    character :: ch, rch

    ! Read the input lines
    read(*, '(A)') s
    read(*, '(A)') t

    slen = len_trim(s)
    tlen = len_trim(t)

    ! Allocate the used array
    allocate( used(1:slen) )
    used = .false.

    ! Initialize tmap based on 't' string
    do i = 1, tlen
        ch = t(i:i)
        tmap(ichar(ch)) = tmap(ichar(ch)) + 1
    end do

    ! First loop to count ura
    do i = 1, slen
        if (used(i)) cycle
        ch = s(i:i)
        if (tmap(ichar(ch)) > 0) then
            ura = ura + 1
            tmap(ichar(ch)) = tmap(ichar(ch)) - 1
            used(i) = .true.
        end if
    end do

    ! Second loop to count opa
    do i = 1, slen
        if (used(i)) cycle
        ch = s(i:i)
        rch = reverse_char(ch)
        if (tmap(ichar(rch)) > 0) then
            opa = opa + 1
            tmap(ichar(rch)) = tmap(ichar(rch)) - 1
            used(i) = .true.
        end if
    end do

    print *, ura, opa

contains

    function reverse_char(ch) result(r)
        character, intent(in) :: ch
        character :: r
        if (ch >= 'a' .and. ch <= 'z') then
            r = achar(ichar(ch) - 32)
        else if (ch >= 'A' .and. ch <= 'Z') then
            r = achar(ichar(ch) + 32)
        else
            r = ch
        end if
    end function reverse_char

end program codeforces_518_B
